title: Within a mile o' Edinburgh Town
author: Hardy, Robina F.
snippet: It was a pleasant scene, and one on which a passing stranger wouldnaturally like to linger. Any such observer might readily have notedsome little out-lying hamlets on the eastern side of the long, slopingplain, where the old Dalkeith Road still winds its sinuous way. Thepilgrim of to-day would look in vain for most of these villages—they arethings of the past.
